input_text:
Job Title: Sr. PM RSC Business Ops, Robotics Supply Chain

Location: Westborough, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Distribution, Engineering, Supply Chain

Description:
Description

The Business Operations Sr. Project Manager for Amazon Robotics Supply Chain (RSC) Business Operations and Strategy manages high impact, cross functional technology projects with a goal to improve systems and tools to support Amazon Robotics' growth.

Working across Global Robotics Delivery (GRD) the Sr. PM will drive the technology roadmap for RSC and improve tools and mechanisms to run operations and create efficiencies. The role will manage the ongoing development of RSC metrics and project manage technical programs to support planning, logistics, order management, NPI, procurement and business operations.

This position requires strong project management skills, excellent organizational abilities, experience with supply chain systems transformations, a background in creating data visualizations and metric deveopment.

Key job responsibilities

Project manage technical programs to enhance/transform supply chain systems and tools.Lead current intiatives to improve Data Analytics and Master Data Management.Support the RSC Technology roadmap, drive priorities and provide Subject Matter Expert (SME) input and guide direction of projects.Support the project intake processes and create mechanisms to update RSC on project status'.Communicate goals and metrics to senior management verbally and through written artifacts.Develop metrics and corresponding data visualizations based on gap analysis and business needs.Work closely with manufacturing and tech deploy on process improvements and technology needs to drive shared operational goals.

A day in the life

Amazon offers a full range of benefits for you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:

 Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) Plan

If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If youâ€™re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Boston, MA, USA | North Reading, MA, USA | Westborough, MA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 7+ years of program or project management experience Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams 7+ years of delivering cross functional projects experience 7+ years of supply chain experience

Preferred Qualifications

 Master's degree, or MBA in supply chain, business, engineering, finance or related technical or quantitative field 6+ years of Tableau or equivalent tools experience

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2618431

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
